qas.question: Whed did the British and French invade Beijing?
What happened to the Old Summer Palace?

context: Ratification of the treaty the following year led to resumption of hostilities and in <a0_0>1860<a0_0/>, with Anglo-French forces marching on Beijing, the emperor and his court fled the capital for the imperial hunting lodge at <a1_0>Rehe<a1_0/>. Once in Beijing, the Anglo-French forces looted the Old Summer Palace, and in an act of revenge for the arrest of several Englishmen, <a2_0>burnt it to the ground<a2_0/>. Prince Gong, a younger half-brother of the emperor, who had been left as his brother's proxy in the capital, was forced to sign the <a3_0>Convention of Beijing<a3_0/>. Meanwhile, the humiliated emperor died the following year at Rehe.
